result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Walstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
Court costs waived based upon substantial restitution ordered.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 45 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release privileges.
AMENDED 04-18-2017:  Huber release granted for the purpose of outpatient treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R. Walstrom

defendant.name: Walstrom, Daniel R.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC that defendant paid all obligations in full.  Please cancel the hearing.
Probation review hearing on February 5, 2018 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Daniel Walstrom requesting huber for treatment.
Memo from Chambers of Circuit Judge to amend the JOC to allow huber release for the purpose of outpatient treatment.
Letter from defendant requesting huber privileges for childcare.  Request denied by the court.
Letter from Crime Victim Compensation Program.

Defendant Daniel R. Walstrom in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to the charge.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court has received and reviewed the VIS as well as the other letters received.  State recommends 1 yr. probation with condition of 90 days jail; restitution of $8794.29 paid by the Crime Victim Compensation Program, letter presented to the Court.  Closing arguments by defense counsel; was just informed of the restitution today and request a restitution hrg.  Defendant addressed the court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 1 yr. probation w/cond: 45 days in PCJ w/work release; comply w/any assessment or counseling if required by P&P; provide a DNA sample; determine restitution of $8794.29 and pay according to a schedule as set up by P&P; gives defendant 60 days to request a restitution hrg.; waive costs based upon substantial restitution; no contact with K.F. or J.F. or their residence or farm without advanced written permission of P&P; advised of appeal rights.
Defendant's character reference letters (pages not numbered0
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 4, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Daniel R. Walstrom in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, argue sentencing, request another date.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Daniel R. Walstrom in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received copy of criminal complaint, waives further reading and is aware of max. penalties and rights, enters NGP.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Roger M. Hillestad retained by Defendant, Daniel R. Walstrom
